meanings.definition: Chromoplasts: Organelles in plant cells that contain pigments.
meanings.sent1: The chromoplasts in the plant cells help give flowers their beautiful colors.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study chromoplasts to understand how plants produce different pigments.
meanings.sent3: The chromoplasts in the cell were having a colorful party, each showing off its unique pigment.
meanings.sent4: The chromoplasts were like tiny paint palettes, mixing colors to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the chromoplasts looked like tiny, colorful gems scattered throughout the cell.

meanings.definition: Chromoplasts: Structures responsible for giving fruits and flowers their color.
meanings.sent1: The bright red color of the apple was due to the chromoplasts in its skin.
meanings.sent2: Farmers know that healthy chromoplasts are essential for vibrant fruits and flowers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chromoplasts decided to paint all the fruits in the orchard different colors overnight.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the chromoplasts worked tirelessly, painting petals with hues of pink and yellow.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the chromoplasts illuminated the flowers, creating a magical display of colors.
